body:
Comment 1: 
bytes.Map and strings.Map are interesting as functions
because the details of managing the collection of runes
are intricate and worth doing well in one place.

The bytes.Map you describe sounds like it would be more
idiomatic as a simple for range loop.  The loop would have
the advantage of being able to reuse the buffer instead of
allocating a new one.

Either way, this kind of discussion is better done on the
mailing list first.
